case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only
case_circumstances:
Partial human skeletal remains found 4/24/1983 75-100 yards north of the check-in station for the Ludington Sate Park and about 100-150 yards west of M-116, in section 29 of Hamlin Township, Mason Coutny, MI. The bones were located ina bone shaped hole about 20 feet deep, 25-35 feet wide, and 100-125 feet long. On 3/28/1984 additional human bones were discovered in the same location.
The skeleton is only approximately 50% complete (elements present: left tibia, left and right femora, left and right os coxae, left humerus, left radius and ulna, vertebrae, ribs, and mandible).
case_head_hair: skeletonization precludes analysis of head hair
case_body_hair: skeletonization precludes analysis of body hair
case_facial_hair: skeletonization precludes analysis of facial hair
case_eye_description: skeletonization precludes observations of the eyes
